page.title: 10LAW AND ORDER IN BRECHIN
page.content: Brechin has one police station in {Clerk St.}From there{15}police officers of{Tayside Police}operate.(4 sergeants, 8 constables and 3 landward officers responsible for the larger local villages). There is no C.I.D. Officers patrol both on foot and in cars. Last year{161}arrests were made with Breach of the Peace and Vandalism by far the most frequent. Motoring offences and theft were also common but murder, mugging, rape and armed robbery were extremely rare. The local{Justice of the Peace}(Mr A. Buchan) deals with less serious offences in a "courtroom" in Bank St. The stiffest sentences that he can give are 60 days imprisonment or a fine of Â£1000. In court the J.P. has a legal adviser in the form of a clerk. More serious crimes are tried at the {Sheriff Court}in Forfar.
